data.event: The organization was founded in 1920 by Paramahansa Yogananda, an Indian swami who introduced America to yoga and gained a worldwide following with his "Autobiography of a Yogi.
As docents explained, the Mount Washington Hotel opened there in 1910 and was connected to the flatlands 940 feet below by an incline railway that was dismantled long ago.

event.title: 1925 the Mission Revival-style hotel was purchased

data.event: In 1925 the Mission Revival-style hotel was purchased by Yogananda, who made the site his headquarters.

event.title: worship services in the Chapel of the Jesus Ethic on Aug. 12, 1973

data.event: The conservancy's tour booklet offered this striking anecdote: "It was while conducting worship services in the Chapel of the Jesus Ethic on Aug. 12, 1973, that Colton experienced what is described by her followers as a levitation miracle.
